title: White House Welcomes Discussion on Bump Stocks
description:
(5 Oct 2017) The White House on Thursday expressed condolences to the families of the three U.S. Army special operations commandos who were killed in an attack in Niger while the U.S. was providing assistance to security force counter-terror operations.
One soldier from a "partner member nation" was also killed but U.S. officials have not specified the nationality, Two additional U.S. servicemembers were injured.
Sanders said the administration's "thoughts and prayers are with the families and friends of the fallen servicemembers who made the ultimate sacrifice in defense of the freedoms we hold so dear."
She also said the White House welcomes conversations about banning gun "bump stocks," adding that it wants to be part of the conversation.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/1d8adff247eda353f4b2865825742e79 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
